org.wikipedia
Class Wiki

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.Wiki
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Wiki
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is a somewhat sketchy bot framework for editing MediaWiki wikis. Requires JDK 1.6 (6.0) or greater. Uses the MediaWiki API for most operations. It is recommended that the server runs the latest version of MediaWiki (1.18), otherwise some functions may not work.

Extended documentation is available here. All wikilinks are relative to the English Wikipedia and all timestamps are in your wiki's time zone.

Please file bug reports here (fast) or at the Google code bug tracker (slow).

See Also:
Serialized Form
Author:
MER-C and contributors

Field Detail

MEDIA_NAMESPACE

public static final int MEDIA_NAMESPACE
Denotes the namespace of images and media, such that there is no description page. Uses the "Media:" prefix.

Since:
0.03
See Also:
FILE_NAMESPACE, Constant Field Values

SPECIAL_NAMESPACE

public static final int SPECIAL_NAMESPACE
Denotes the namespace of pages with the "Special:" prefix. Note that many methods dealing with special pages may spew due to raw content not being available.

Since:
0.03
See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAIN_NAMESPACE

public static final int MAIN_NAMESPACE
Denotes the main namespace, with no prefix.

Since:
0.03
See Also:
Constant Field Values

Since:

Constant Field Values

PROJECT_NAMESPACE

public static final int PROJECT_NAMESPACE
Denotes the namespace for pages relating to the project, with prefix "Project:". It also goes by the name of whatever the project name was.

Since:
0.03
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROJECT_TALK_NAMESPACE

public static final int PROJECT_TALK_NAMESPACE
Denotes the namespace for talk pages relating to project pages, with prefix "Project talk:". It also goes by the name of whatever the project name was, + "talk:".

Since:
0.03
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FILE_NAMESPACE

public static final int FILE_NAMESPACE
Denotes the namespace for image/file description pages. Has the prefix prefix "File:". Do not create these directly, use upload() instead. (This namespace used to have the prefix "Image:", hence the name.)

Since:
0.25
See Also:
MEDIA_NAMESPACE, Constant Field Values

public static final int FILE_TALK_NAMESPACE
Denotes talk pages for image description pages. Has the prefix "File talk:".

Since:
0.25
See Also:
Constant Field Values

Denotes a non-protected page.

Since:
0.09
See Also:
Constant Field Values

SEMI_PROTECTION

public static final int SEMI_PROTECTION
Denotes semi-protection (i.e. only autoconfirmed users can edit this page) [edit=autoconfirmed;move=autoconfirmed].

Since:
0.09
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FULL_PROTECTION

public static final int FULL_PROTECTION
Denotes full protection (i.e. only admins can edit this page) [edit=sysop;move=sysop].

Since:
0.09
See Also:
Constant Field Values

MOVE_PROTECTION

public static final int MOVE_PROTECTION
Denotes move protection (i.e. only admins can move this page) [move=sysop]. We don't define semi-move protection because only autoconfirmed users can move pages anyway.

Since:
0.09
See Also:
Constant Field Values

SEMI_AND_MOVE_PROTECTION

public static final int SEMI_AND_MOVE_PROTECTION
Denotes move and semi-protection (i.e. autoconfirmed editors can edit the page, but you need to be a sysop to move) [edit=autoconfirmed;move=sysop]. Naturally, this value (4) is equal to SEMI_PROTECTION (1) + MOVE_PROTECTION (3).

Since:
0.09
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROTECTED_DELETED_PAGE

public static final int PROTECTED_DELETED_PAGE
Denotes protected deleted pages [create=sysop].

Since:
0.12
See Also:
Constant Field Values

UPLOAD_PROTECTION

public static final int UPLOAD_PROTECTION
Denotes protected images where the corresponding image description page can be edited.

Since:
0.21
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Wiki

public Wiki()
Creates a new connection to the English Wikipedia.

Since:
0.02

Wiki

public Wiki(java.lang.String domain)
Creates a new connection to a wiki. WARNING: if the wiki uses a $wgScriptpath other than the default /w, you need to call getScriptPath() to automatically set it. Alternatively, you can use the constructor below if you know it in advance.

Parameters:
domain - the wiki domain name e.g. en.wikipedia.org (defaults to en.wikipedia.org)

Wiki

public Wiki(java.lang.String domain,
            java.lang.String scriptPath)
Creates a new connection to a wiki with $wgScriptpath set to scriptPath.

Parameters:
domain - the wiki domain name
scriptPath - the script path
Since:
0.14

getScriptPath

public java.lang.String getScriptPath()
                               throws java.io.IOException
Detects the $wgScriptpath wiki variable and sets the bot framework up to use it. You need not call this if you know the script path is /w. See also [[mw:Manual:$wgScriptpath]].

Returns:
the script path, if you have any use for it
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.14

Since:
0.18

login

public void login(java.lang.String username,
                  char[] password)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException
Logs in to the wiki. This method is thread-safe. If the specified username or password is incorrect, the thread blocks for 20 seconds then throws an exception.

Parameters:
username - a username
password - a password (as a char[] due to JPasswordField)
Throws:
javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException - if the login failed due to incorrect username and/or password
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
See Also:
logout()

logout

public void logout()
Logs out of the wiki. This method is thread safe (so that we don't log out during an edit). All operations are conducted offline, so you can serialize this Wiki first.

See Also:
login(java.lang.String, char[]), logoutServerSide()

logoutServerSide

public void logoutServerSide()
                      throws java.io.IOException
Logs out of the wiki and destroys the session on the server. You will need to log in again instead of just reading in a serialized wiki. Equivalent to [[Special:Userlogout]]. This method is thread safe (so that we don't log out during an edit). WARNING: kills all concurrent sessions - if you are logged in with a browser this will log you out there as well.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.14
See Also:
login(java.lang.String, char[]), logout()

parse

public java.lang.String parse(java.lang.String markup)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Renders the specified wiki markup by passing it to the MediaWiki parser through the API. (Note: this isn't implemented locally because I can't be stuffed porting Parser.php). One use of this method is to emulate the previewing functionality of the MediaWiki software.

Parameters:

Returns:
the parsed markup as HTML
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs

parseList

public static java.lang.String[] parseList(java.lang.String list)
Parses a list of links into its individual elements. Such a list should be in the form: 
  * [[Main Page]]
  * [[Wikipedia:Featured picture candidates]]
  * [[:File:Example.png]]
in which case { "Main Page", "Wikipedia:Featured picture candidates", "File:Example.png" } is the return value.

Parameters:
list - a list of pages
Returns:
an array of the page titles
Since:
0.11
See Also:
formatList(java.lang.String[])

formatList

public static java.lang.String formatList(java.lang.String[] pages)
Formats a list of pages, say, generated from one of the query methods into something that would be editor-friendly. Does the exact opposite of parseList(), i.e. { "Main Page", "Wikipedia:Featured picture candidates", "File:Example.png" } becomes the string: 
  *[[:Main Page]]
  *[[:Wikipedia:Featured picture candidates]]
  *[[:File:Example.png]]

Parameters:
pages - an array of page titles
Returns:
see above
Since:
0.14
See Also:
parseList(java.lang.String)

intersection

public static java.lang.String[] intersection(java.lang.String[] a,
                                              java.lang.String[] b)
Determines the intersection of two lists of pages a and b, i.e. a b. Such lists might be generated from the various list methods below. Examples from the English Wikipedia: 
  // find all orphaned and unwikified articles
  String[] articles = Wiki.intersection(wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("All orphaned articles", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE),
      wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("All pages needing to be wikified", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE));

  // find all (notable) living people who are related to Barack Obama
  String[] people = Wiki.intersection(wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("Living people", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE),
      wikipedia.whatLinksHere("Barack Obama", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE));

Parameters:
a - a list of pages
b - another list of pages
Returns:
a b (as String[])
Since:
0.04

relativeComplement

public static java.lang.String[] relativeComplement(java.lang.String[] a,
                                                    java.lang.String[] b)
Determines the list of articles that are in a but not b, i.e. a \ b. This is not the same as b \ a. Such lists might be generated from the various lists below. Some examples from the English Wikipedia: 
  // find all Martian crater articles that do not have an infobox
  String[] articles = Wiki.relativeComplement(wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("Craters on Mars"),
      wikipedia.whatTranscludesHere("Template:MarsGeo-Crater", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE));

  // find all images without a description that haven't been tagged "no license"
  String[] images = Wiki.relativeComplement(wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("Images lacking a description"),
      wikipedia.getCategoryMembers("All images with unknown copyright status"));

Parameters:
a - a list of pages
b - another list of pages
Returns:
a \ b
Since:
0.14

getTalkPage

public java.lang.String getTalkPage(java.lang.String title)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Returns the corresponding talk page to this page. Override to add custom namespaces.

Parameters:
title - the page title
Returns:
the name of the talk page corresponding to title or "" if we cannot recognise it
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given title is in a talk namespace or we try to retrieve the talk page of a Special: or Media: page.
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.10

getPageInfo

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getPageInfo(java.lang.String page)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
Gets various page info. Returns: 
  {
      "displaytitle" => "iPod"         , // the title of the page that is actually displayed (String)
      "protection"   => NO_PROTECTION  , // the protection level of the page (Integer)
      "token"        => "\+"           , // an edit token for the page, must be logged
                                         // in to be non-trivial (String)
      "exists"       => true           , // whether the page exists (Boolean)
      "lastpurged"   => 20110101000000 , // when the page was last purged (Calendar), null if the
                                         // page does not exist
      "lastrevid"    => 123456789L     , // the revid of the top revision (Long), -1L if the page
                                         // does not exist
      "size"         => 5000           , // the size of the page (Integer), -1 if the page does
                                         // not exist
      "cascade"      => false          , // whether this page is cascade protected (Boolean)
      "timestamp"    => makeCalendar() , // when this method was called (Calendar)
      "watchtoken"   => "\+"             // watchlist token (String)
  }

Parameters:
page - the page to get info for
Returns:
(see above)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.23

getProtectionLevel

public int getProtectionLevel(java.lang.String title)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Gets the protection status of a page.

Parameters:
title - the title of the page
Returns:
one of the various protection levels (i.e,. NO_PROTECTION, SEMI_PROTECTION, MOVE_PROTECTION, FULL_PROTECTION, SEMI_AND_MOVE_PROTECTION, PROTECTED_DELETED_PAGE)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.10

namespace

public int namespace(java.lang.String title)
              throws java.io.IOException
Returns the namespace a page is in. No need to override this to add custom namespaces, though you may want to define static fields e.g. public static final int PORTAL_NAMESPACE = 100; for the Portal namespace on the English Wikipedia.

Parameters:
title - the title of the page
Returns:
one of namespace types above, or a number for custom namespaces or ALL_NAMESPACES if we can't make sense of it
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs while populating the namespace cache
Since:
0.03
See Also:
namespaceIdentifier(int)

namespaceIdentifier

public java.lang.String namespaceIdentifier(int namespace)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
For a given namespace denoted as an integer, fetch the corresponding identification string e.g. namespaceIdentifier(1) should return "Talk". (This does the exact opposite to namespace().

Parameters:
namespace - an integer corresponding to a namespace. If it does not correspond to a namespace, we assume you mean the main namespace (i.e. return "").
Returns:
the identifier of the namespace
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the namespace cache has not been populated, and a network error occurs when populating it
Since:
0.25
See Also:
namespace(java.lang.String)

getRenderedText

public java.lang.String getRenderedText(java.lang.String title)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Gets the contents of a page, rendered in HTML (as opposed to wikitext). WARNING: only supports special pages in certain circumstances, for example getRenderedText("Special:Recentchanges") returns the 50 most recent change to the wiki in pretty-print HTML. You should test any use of this method on-wiki through the text {{Special:Specialpage}}. Use getImage() to fetch an image. Be aware of any transclusion limits, as outlined at [[Wikipedia:Template limits]].

Parameters:
title - the title of the page
Returns:
the rendered contents of that page
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.10

edit

public void edit(java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String text,
                 java.lang.String summary)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Edits a page by setting its text to the supplied value. This method is thread safe and blocks for a minimum time as specified by the throttle. The edit will be marked bot if isMarkBot() == true and minor if isMarkMinor() == true.

Parameters:
text - the text of the page
title - the title of the page
summary - the edit summary. See [[Help:Edit summary]]. Summaries longer than 200 characters are truncated server-side.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialException - if page is protected and we can't edit it
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if you try to edit a Special: or a Media: page
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
See Also:
getPageText(java.lang.String)

edit

public void edit(java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String text,
                 java.lang.String summary,
                 java.util.Calendar basetime)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Edits a page by setting its text to the supplied value. This method is thread safe and blocks for a minimum time as specified by the throttle. The edit will be marked bot if isMarkBot() == true and minor if isMarkMinor() == true.

Parameters:
text - the text of the page
title - the title of the page
summary - the edit summary. See [[Help:Edit summary]]. Summaries longer than 200 characters are truncated server-side.
basetime - the timestamp of the revision on which text is based, used to check for edit conflicts. null disables this.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialException - if page is protected and we can't edit it

                 boolean movetalk,
                 boolean movesubpages)

rollback

public void rollback(Wiki.Revision revision)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Reverts a series of edits on the same page by the same user quickly provided that they are the most recent revisions on that page. If this is not the case, then this method does nothing. See [[mw:Manual:Parameters to index.php#Actions]] (look under rollback) for more information. The edit and reverted edits will be marked as bot if isMarkBot() == true.

Parameters:
revision - the revision to revert. revision.isTop() must be true for the rollback to succeed
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException - if the user is not an admin
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialExpiredException - if cookies have expired
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if the user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Since:
0.19

rollback

public void rollback(Wiki.Revision revision,
                     boolean bot,
                     java.lang.String reason)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Reverts a series of edits on the same page by the same user quickly provided that they are the most recent revisions on that page. If this is not the case, then this method does nothing. See [[mw:Manual:Parameters to index.php#Actions]] (look under rollback) for more information.

Parameters:
revision - the revision to revert. revision.isTop() must be true for the rollback to succeed
bot - whether to mark this edit and the reverted revisions as bot edits (ignored if we cannot do this)
reason - (optional) a reason for the rollback. Use "" for the default ([[MediaWiki:Revertpage]]).
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialExpiredException - if cookies have expired
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException - if the user is not an admin
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if the user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Since:
0.19

undo

public void undo(Wiki.Revision rev,
                 Wiki.Revision to,
                 java.lang.String reason,
                 boolean minor,
                 boolean bot)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Undoes revisions, equivalent to the "undo" button in the GUI page history. A quick explanation on how this might work - suppose the edit history was as follows:
  • (revid=541) 2009-01-13 00:01 92.45.43.227
  • (revid=325) 2008-12-10 11:34 Example user
  • (revid=314) 2008-12-10 10:15 127.0.0.1
  • (revid=236) 2008-08-08 08:00 Anonymous
  • (revid=200) 2008-07-31 16:46 EvilCabalMember
Then: 
  wiki.undo(wiki.getRevision(314L), null, reason, false); // undo revision 314 only
  wiki.undo(wiki.getRevision(236L), wiki.getRevision(325L), reason, false); // undo revisions 236-325
This will only work if revision 541 or any subsequent edits do not clash with the change resulting from the undo.

Parameters:
rev - a revision to undo
to - the most recent in a range of revisions to undo. Set to null to undo only one revision.
reason - an edit summary (optional). Use "" to get the default [[MediaWiki:Undo-summary]].
minor - whether this is a minor edit
bot - whether this is a bot edit
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialExpiredException - if cookies have expired
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialException - if page is protected and we can't edit it
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the revisions are not on the same page.
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Since:
0.20

parseRevision

protected Wiki.Revision parseRevision(java.lang.String xml,
                                      java.lang.String title)
Parses stuff of the form title="L. Sprague de Camp" timestamp="2006-08-28T23:48:08Z" minor="" comment="robot Modifying: [[bg: ]]" into useful revision objects. Used by contribs(), watchlist(), getPageHistory() rangeContribs() and recentChanges(). NOTE: if RevisionDelete was used on a revision, the relevant values will be null.

Parameters:
xml - the XML to parse
title - an optional title parameter if we already know what it is (use "" if we don't)
Returns:
the Revision encoded in the XML
Since:
0.17

revisionsToWikitext

public java.lang.String revisionsToWikitext(Wiki.Revision[] revisions)
Turns a list of revisions into human-readable wikitext. Be careful, as slowness may result when copying large amounts of wikitext produced by this method, or by the wiki trying to parse it. Takes the form of:

*(diff link) 2009-01-01 00:00 User (talk | contribs) (edit summary)

Parameters:
revisions - a list of revisions
Returns:
those revisions as wikitext
Since:
0.20

getImage

public byte[] getImage(java.lang.String title,
                       int width,
                       int height)
                throws java.io.IOException
Fetches a thumbnail of an image file and returns the image data in a byte[]. To recover the old behavior (BufferedImage), use ImageIO.read(new ByteArrayInputStream(getImage("Example.jpg")));

Parameters:
title - the title of the image without the File: prefix (i.e. Example.jpg, not File:Example.jpg)

height - the height of the thumbnail (use -1 for actual height)
Returns:
the image data
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:

getFileMetadata

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFileMetadata(java.lang.String file)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
Gets the file metadata for a file. Note that getImage() reads directly into a BufferedImage object, so you won't be able to get all metadata that way. The keys are: * size (file size, Integer) * width (Integer) * height (Integer) * mime (MIME type, String) * plus EXIF metadata (Strings)

Parameters:
file - the image to get metadata for, without the File: prefix
Returns:
the metadata for the image
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.20

upload

public void upload(java.io.File file,
                   java.lang.String filename,
                   java.lang.String contents,
                   java.lang.String reason)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Uploads an image. Equivalent to [[Special:Upload]]. Supported extensions are (case-insensitive) "png", "jpg", "gif" and "svg". You need to be logged on to do this. This method is thread safe and subject to the throttle.

Parameters:
file - the image file
filename - the target file name (Example.png, not File:Example.png)
contents - the contents of the image description page, set to "" if overwriting an existing file
reason - an upload summary (defaults to contents, use "" to not specify one)
Throws:
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException - if not logged in
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialException - if page is protected and we can't upload
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialExpiredException - if cookies have expired
java.io.IOException - if a network/local filesystem error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if user is blocked
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Since:
0.21

contribs

public Wiki.Revision[] contribs(java.lang.String user,
                                int... ns)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Gets the contributions of a user in a particular namespace. Equivalent to [[Special:Contributions]]. Be careful when using this method because the user may have a high edit count e.g. enWiki.contribs("MER-C", Wiki.MAIN_NAMESPACE).length > 30000.

Parameters:
user - the user or IP to get contributions for
ns - a list of namespaces to filter by, empty = all namespaces.
Returns:
the contributions of the user
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.17

rangeContribs

public Wiki.Revision[] rangeContribs(java.lang.String range)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Gets the contributions by a range of IP v4 addresses. Supported ranges are /8, /16 and /24. Do be careful with this, as calls such as enWiki.rangeContribs("152.163.0.0/16"); // let's get all the contributions for this AOL range! might just kill your program.

Parameters:
range - the CIDR range of IP addresses to get contributions for
Returns:
the contributions of that range
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if we aren't able to parse the range
Since:
0.17

contribs

                                java.lang.String prefix,
                                java.util.Calendar offset,
                                int... ns)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Gets the contributions for a user, an IP address or a range of IP addresses. Equivalent to [[Special:Contributions]].

Parameters:
user - the user to get contributions for
offset - fetch edits no older than this date
ns - a list of namespaces to filter by, empty = all namespaces.
prefix - a prefix of usernames. Overrides user.
Returns:
contributions of this user
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.17

emailUser

public void emailUser(Wiki.User user,
                      java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.String subject,
                      boolean emailme)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Sends an email message to a user in a similar manner to [[Special:Emailuser]]. You and the target user must have a confirmed email address and the target user must have email contact enabled. Messages are sent in plain text (no wiki markup or HTML).

Parameters:
user - a Wikipedia user with email enabled
subject - the subject of the message
message - the plain text message
emailme - whether to send a copy of the message to your email address
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
javax.security.auth.login.CredentialExpiredException - if cookies have expired
javax.security.auth.login.AccountLockedException - if you have been blocked from sending email
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if email is disabled or if you do not have a verified email address
javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
Since:
0.24

                                 int... ns)

                                 javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException

search

public java.lang.String[][] search(java.lang.String search,
                                   int... namespaces)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Performs a full text search of the wiki. Equivalent to [[Special:Search]], or that little textbox in the sidebar. Returns an array of search results, where: 
  results[0] == page name
  results[1] == parsed section name (may be "")
  results[2] == snippet of page text

Parameters:
search - a search string
namespaces - the namespaces to search. If no parameters are passed then the default is MAIN_NAMESPACE only.
Returns:
the search results
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.14

linksearch

public java.util.ArrayList[] linksearch(java.lang.String pattern)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Searches the wiki for external links. Equivalent to [[Special:Linksearch]]. Returns two lists, where the first is the list of pages and the second is the list of urls. The index of a page in the first list corresponds to the index of the url on that page in the second list. Wildcards (*) are only permitted at the start of the search string.

Parameters:
pattern - the pattern (String) to search for (e.g. example.com, *.example.com)
Returns:
two lists - index 0 is the list of pages (String), index 1 is the list of urls (instance of java.net.URL)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.06

linksearch

public java.util.ArrayList[] linksearch(java.lang.String pattern,
                                        java.lang.String protocol,
                                        int... ns)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Searches the wiki for external links. Equivalent to [[Special:Linksearch]]. Returns two lists, where the first is the list of pages and the second is the list of urls. The index of a page in the first list corresponds to the index of the url on that page in the second list. Wildcards (*) are only permitted at the start of the search string.

Parameters:
pattern - the pattern (String) to search for (e.g. example.com, *.example.com)
ns - a list of namespaces to filter by, empty = all namespaces.
protocol - one of { http, https, ftp, irc, gopher, telnet, nntp, worldwind, mailto, news, svn, git, mms } or "" (equivalent to http)
Returns:
two lists - index 0 is the list of pages (String), index 1 is the list of urls (instance of java.net.URL)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.24

getIPBlockList

protected Wiki.LogEntry[] getIPBlockList(java.lang.String user,
                                         java.util.Calendar start,
                                         java.util.Calendar end,
                                         int amount)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Fetches part of the list of currently operational blocks. Equivalent to [[Special:Ipblocklist]]. WARNING: cannot tell whether a particular IP is autoblocked as this is non-public data (see also [[bugzilla:12321]] and [[foundation:Privacy policy]]). Don't call this directly, use one of the two above methods instead.

Parameters:
user - a particular user that might have been blocked. Use "" to not specify one. May be an IP (e.g. "127.0.0.1") or a CIDR range (e.g. "127.0.0.0/16") but not an autoblock (e.g. "#123456").
start - what timestamp to start. Use null to not specify one.
end - what timestamp to end. Use null to not specify one.
amount - the number of blocks to retrieve. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to not specify one.
Returns:
a LogEntry[] of the blocks
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start date is before end date
Since:
0.12

getLogEntries

public Wiki.LogEntry[] getLogEntries(java.util.Calendar start,
                                     java.util.Calendar end,
                                     int amount,
                                     java.lang.String log,
                                     Wiki.User user,
                                     java.lang.String target,
                                     int namespace)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Gets the specified amount of log entries between the given times by the given user on the given target. Equivalent to [[Special:Log]]. WARNING: the start date is the most recent of the dates given, and the order of enumeration is from newest to oldest.

Parameters:
start - what timestamp to start. Use null to not specify one.
end - what timestamp to end. Use null to not specify one.
amount - the amount of log entries to get. If both start and end are defined, this is ignored. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to not specify one.
log - what log to get (e.g. DELETION_LOG)
user - the user performing the action. Use null not to specify one.
target - the target of the action. Use "" not to specify one.
namespace - filters by namespace. Returns empty if namespace doesn't exist.
Returns:
the specified log entries
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start < end or amount < 1
Since:
0.08

caller - 1 if ipblocklist, 2 if imagehistory

the parsed log entry

listPages

public java.lang.String[] listPages(java.lang.String prefix,
                                    int level,
                                    int namespace)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Lists pages with titles containing a certain prefix with a certain protection level and in a certain namespace. Equivalent to [[Special:Allpages]], [[Special:Prefixindex]], [[Special:Protectedpages]] and [[Special:Allmessages]] (if namespace == MEDIAWIKI_NAMESPACE). WARNING: Limited to 500 values (5000 for bots), unless a prefix or protection level is specified.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix of the title. Use "" to not specify one.
level - a protection level. Use NO_PROTECTION to not specify one. WARNING: it is not currently possible to specify a combination of both semi and move protection
namespace - a namespace. ALL_NAMESPACES is not suppported, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.
Returns:
the specified list of pages
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.09

listPages

public java.lang.String[] listPages(java.lang.String prefix,
                                    int level,
                                    int namespace,
                                    int minimum,
                                    int maximum)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Lists pages with titles containing a certain prefix with a certain protection level and in a certain namespace. Equivalent to [[Special:Allpages]], [[Special:Prefixindex]], [[Special:Protectedpages]] [[Special:Allmessages]] (if namespace == MEDIAWIKI_NAMESPACE), [[Special:Shortpages]] and [[Special:Longpages]]. WARNING: Limited to 500 values (5000 for bots), unless a prefix, (max|min)imum size or protection level is specified.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix of the title. Use "" to not specify one.
level - a protection level. Use NO_PROTECTION to not specify one. WARNING: it is not currently possible to specify a combination of both semi and move protection
namespace - a namespace. ALL_NAMESPACES is not suppported, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.
minimum - the minimum size in bytes these pages can be. Use -1 to not specify one.
maximum - the maximum size in bytes these pages can be. Use -1 to not specify one.
Returns:
the specified list of pages
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.09

                                int rcoptions)
                         throws java.io.IOException

Returns:

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.23

recentChanges

protected Wiki.Revision[] recentChanges(int amount,
                                        int rcoptions,
                                        boolean newpages,
                                        int... ns)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Fetches the amount most recent changes in the specified namespace subject to the specified constraints. WARNING: The recent changes table only stores new pages for about a month. It is not possible to retrieve changes before then. Equivalent to [[Special:Recentchanges]].

Note: Log entries in recent changes have a revid of 0!

Parameters:
amount - the number of entries to return
ns - a list of namespaces to filter by, empty = all namespaces.
rcoptions - a bitmask of HIDE_ANON etc that dictate which pages we return.
newpages - show new pages only
Returns:
the recent changes that satisfy these criteria
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.23

getInterWikiBacklinks

public java.lang.String[][] getInterWikiBacklinks(java.lang.String prefix)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Fetches all pages that use interwiki links to the specified wiki and the page on that wiki that is linked to. For example, getInterWikiBacklinks("testwiki") may return: 
  {
      { "Spam", "testwiki:Blah" },
      { "Test", "testwiki:Main_Page" }
  }

Here the page [[Spam]] contains the interwiki link [[testwiki:Blah]] and the page [[Test]] contains the interwiki link [[testwiki:Main_Page]]. This does not resolve nested interwiki prefixes, e.g. [[wikt:fr:Test]].

For WMF wikis, see the interwiki mapfor where some prefixes link to.

Parameters:
prefix - the interwiki prefix that denotes a wiki
Returns:
all pages that contain interwiki links to said wiki
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.23

getInterWikiBacklinks

public java.lang.String[][] getInterWikiBacklinks(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                  java.lang.String title)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Fetches all pages that use interwiki links with a certain prefix and title. prefix refers to the wiki being linked to and title refers to the page on said wiki being linked to. In wiki syntax, this is [[prefix:title]]. This does not resolve nested prefixes, e.g. [[wikt:fr:Test]].

Example: If [[Test]] and [[Spam]] both contain the interwiki link [[testwiki:Blah]] then getInterWikiBacklinks("testwiki", "Blah"); will return (sorted by title) 

  {
      { "Spam", "testwiki:Blah" },
      { "Test", "testwiki:Blah" }
  }

For WMF wikis, see the interwiki mapfor where some prefixes link to.

Parameters:
prefix - the interwiki prefix to search
title - the title of the page on the other wiki to search for (optional, use "|" to not specify one). Warning: "" is a valid interwiki target!
Returns:
a list of all pages that use interwiki links satisfying the parameters given
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a title is specified without a prefix (the MediaWiki API doesn't like this)
Since:
0.23

fetch

protected java.lang.String fetch(java.lang.String url,
                                 java.lang.String caller)
                          throws java.io.IOException
A generic URL content fetcher. This is only useful for GET requests, which is almost everything that doesn't modify the wiki. Might be useful for subclasses. Here we also check the database lag and wait if it exceeds maxlag. See [[mw:Manual:Maxlag parameter]] for the server-side analog (which isn't implemented here, because I'm too lazy to retry the request).

Parameters:
url - the url to fetch
caller - the caller of this method
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
Since:
0.18
